intro: Phyllanthus × collinum-misuku, commonly known as the hybrid buttonwood, is a shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptic to ovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers, followed by spherical, fleshy fruits that are often brightly colored. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions. The species is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some regions.
